alert.note: Alert for Barry; McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 10 at 12:36PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry and McDonald. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1232 PM CST, river gages showed levels above flood stage and continuing to rise on Flat Creek near Jenkins, and along Big Sugar and Little Sugar Creeks in McDonald County. - This includes the following low water crossings... Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road, Mikes Creek at Highway U, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway C, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, Bentonville Hollow at Highway E and Flat Creek at Highway U. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Pineville, Seligman, Exeter, Washburn, Lanagan, Shell Knob, Butterfield, Emerald Beach, Eagle Rock, Chain-O- Lakes, Arrow Point, Wayne, Ridgley, Powell, Jenkins,and Big Sugar Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
